nodes.bodyText: any advantage in moving settings.xml file from sdk dir? With this here we have to point AndroidStudio to the root, root contains other artifacts not used for daily dev, wondering whether it affects editor experience.
I cloned this PR and opened in AndroidStudio. Though it showed everything when opened first time, after the load/sync there exists only the two modules (core and storage-common). We're good here.
We still need the this dependency for the AddDateInterceptor
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -35,13 +43,10 @@ android {
 dependencies {
     implementation fileTree(dir: "libs", include: ["*.jar"])
     implementation "androidx.annotation:annotation:$annotationsVersion"
+    implementation "com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-databind:$jacksonDatabindVersion"
+    implementation "com.fasterxml.jackson.dataformat:jackson-dataformat-xml:$jacksonDataFormatXmlVersion"
     implementation "com.jakewharton.threetenabp:threetenabp:$threeTenAbpVersion"
     implementation "com.squareup.okhttp3:okhttp:$okHttpVersion"
     implementation "com.squareup.retrofit2:retrofit:$retrofitVersion"
-    implementation "com.jakewharton.threetenabp:threetenabp:$threeTenAbpVersion"
